page.title: 18Cholsey Church
page.content: We visited {Cholsey Church} because it was founded in 986, 100 years before the first Domesday Survey. There have been 63 vicars. There are different styles of windows which indicate that the church has been added to over the centuries. There is a large yew tree outside the main doorway, it has an iron band around it as it is in danger of falling down. The church is outside the village on slightly higher ground, away from thw area that used to be a swamp. Like most churches it faces east. There are many carvings around the outside and some are badly faded and worn through years of wind and rain. The grave of {Agatha Christie} is in the churchyard. She was a famous author of mystery stories who lived in Cholsey. She died in 1972.
